ContentDescription_V1: Identify how people create familiar designed solutions and consider sustainability to meet personal and local community needs
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Identify how people create familiar designed solutions and consider sustainability to meet personal and local community needs
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Explore how technologies use forces to create movement in designed solutions
Explore how plants and animals are grown for food, clothing and shelter
Explore how food is selected and prepared for healthy eating
Explore the characteristics and properties of materials and components that are used to create designed solutions
Explore needs or opportunities for designing, and the technologies needed to realise designed solutions
Visualise, generate, and communicate design ideas through describing, drawing and modelling
Use materials, components, tools, equipment and techniques to produce designed solutions safely
Use personal preferences to evaluate the success of design ideas, processes and solutions including their care for environment
Sequence steps for making designed solutions
Recognise the role of people in design and technologies occupations and explore factors, including sustainability, that impact on the design of solutions to meet community needs
Comment: Removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate how forces and the properties of materials affect the behaviour of a designed solution
Comment: Refined for clarity and to show progression

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate food and fibre production used in modern or traditional societies
Investigate food preparation techniques used in modern or traditional societies
Investigate the suitability of materials, systems, components, tools and equipment for a range of purposes
Critique needs or opportunities for designing and explore and test a variety of materials, components, tools and equipment and the techniques needed to create designed solutions
Generate, develop, and communicate design ideas and decisions using appropriate technical terms and graphical representation techniques
Select and use materials, components, tools and equipment using safe work practices to produce designed solutions
Evaluate design ideas, processes and solutions based on criteria for success developed with guidance and including care for the environment and communities
Plan a sequence of production steps when making designed solutions
Investigate how people in design and technologies occupations address competing considerations, including sustainability, in the design of solutions for current and future use
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate how forces or electrical energy can control movement, sound or light in a designed product or system
Comment: Refined for clarity and to show progression and consistency across the 4 Technologies Contexts

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate how and why food and fibre are produced in managed environments
Comment: Refined for clarity and to show progression and consistency across the 4 Technologies Contexts

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate the role of food preparation in maintaining good health and the importance of food safety and hygiene
Comment: Refined for clarity and to show progression and consistency across the 4 Technologies Contexts

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate characteristics and properties of a range of materials, systems, components, tools and equipment and evaluate the impact of their use
Comment: Refined for clarity and to show progression and consistency across the 4 Technologies Contexts

ContentDescription_V1: Critique needs or opportunities for designing, and investigate materials, components, tools, equipment and processes to achieve intended designed solutions
Comment: Refined for clarity and to show progression

ContentDescription_V1: Generate, develop, communicate and document design ideas and processes for audiences using appropriate technical terms and graphical representation techniques
Apply safe procedures when using a variety of materials, components, tools, equipment and techniques to produce designed solutions
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve progression

ContentDescription_V1: Negotiate criteria for success that include consideration of environmental and social sustainability to evaluate design ideas, processes and solutions
Develop project plans that include consideration of resources when making designed solutions

Examine and prioritise competing factors including social, ethical, economic and sustainability considerations in the development of technologies and designed solutions to meet community needs for preferred futures
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate the ways in which designed solutions evolve locally, nationally, regionally and globally through the creativity, innovation and enterprise of individuals and groups
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Analyse how motion, force and energy are used to manipulate and control electromechanical systems when creating simple, engineered solutions
Analyse how food and fibre are produced when creating managed environments and how these can become more sustainable
Analyse how characteristics and properties of food determine preparation techniques and presentation when creating solutions for healthy eating
Analyse ways to create designed solutions through selecting and combining characteristics and properties of materials, systems, components, tools and equipment
Critique needs or opportunities for designing and investigate, analyse and select from a range of materials, components, tools, equipment and processes to develop design ideas
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Generate, develop and test design ideas, plans and processes using appropriate technical terms and technologies including graphical representation techniques
Effectively and safely use a broad range of materials, components, tools, equipment and techniques to produce designed solutions
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Independently develop criteria for success to evaluate design ideas, processes and solutions and their sustainability
Use project management processes to coordinate production of designed solutions

Critically analyse factors, including social, ethical and sustainability considerations, that impact on designed solutions for global preferred futures and the complex design and production processes involved
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Explain how designed solutions evolve with consideration of preferred futures and the impact of emerging technologies on design decisions
Comment: Refined for clarity, and removed command term to follow on from the content description stem used for knowledge-based content descriptions (‘Students learn about:’)

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate and make judgements on how the characteristics and properties of materials are combined with force, motion and energy to create engineered solutions
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate and make judgements on the ethical and sustainable production and marketing of food and fibre
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate and make judgements on how the principles of food safety, preservation, preparation, presentation and sensory perceptions influence the creation of food solutions for healthy eating
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Investigate and make judgements on how the characteristics and properties of materials, systems, components, tools and equipment can be combined to create designed solutions
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Critique needs or opportunities to develop design briefs and investigate and select an increasingly sophisticated range of materials, systems, components, tools and equipment to develop design ideas
Apply design thinking, creativity, innovation and enterprise skills to develop, modify and communicate design ideas of increasing sophistication
Comment: Refined for clarity and to improve the progression of learning

ContentDescription_V1: Work flexibly to safely test, select, justify and use appropriate technologies and processes to make designed solutions
Evaluate design ideas, processes and solutions against comprehensive criteria for success recognising the need for sustainability
Develop project plans to plan and manage projects individually and collaboratively taking into consideration time, cost, risk and production processes
